definition: see 嘰哩咕嚕|叽哩咕噜[ji1 li5 gu1 lu1]

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
(onom.) for the sound of a bird, an empty stomach etc

sentences.english: His stomach pitched and gurgled like a volcano.
sentences.chinese: 他的肚子叽里咕噜的叫，象火山要爆发。

sentences.english: Those foreigners are jabbering away over there.
sentences.chinese: 那些外国人正在那边叽里咕噜地说个不停。
电视中播放着叽里咕噜的泰语节目。

sentences.english: They began to curse and shout in a babble of languages.
sentences.chinese: 他们开始用不同的语言叽里咕噜地谩骂吵嚷起来。

sentences.english: The two women gabbed away twenty to the dozen.
sentences.chinese: 那两个女人叽里咕噜说个没完没了。

sentences.english: The two women gabbled away twenty to the dozen.
sentences.chinese: 那两个女人叽里咕噜说个没完没了。

sentences.english: The monkey jabbered away in a corner.
sentences.chinese: 那猴子在角落里叽里咕噜地叫个不停。

sentences.english: I remember when I got through there were strange sounds which I could hardly understand.
sentences.chinese: 我记得那次接通后对方叽里咕噜一通，根本听不懂。

sentences.english: He jabbered out the words in what seemed a foreign language.
sentences.chinese: 他叽里咕噜讲的好像是外国话。

definition: strange accent/odd manner of speaking or singing
to mumble in whispers/to mutter to oneself
bunch/cluster/classifier for bunched objects/to hang down in a bunch/to droop
to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手畫腳|比手画脚
unable to make sense of what one is hearing
to murmur/to speak in a low voice
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
